title: Cyberpunk 2077 Celebrates 5th Anniversary With Heartfelt Messages From Developers
description: Cyberpunk 2077 celebrates its fifth anniversary today, December 10, as the RPG originally launched back on December 10, 2020. It's been a busy, tumultuous five years for the game, and now one of the game's designers, Pawel Sasko, has weighed in with a heartfelt message to mark the milestone. "I feel nothing but gratitude towards each one of you," he said. "I feel so thankful to be part of this community. I love all the pictures, videos; all the cosplay and mods that you have done for Cyberpunk 2077. It has been an incredible adventure." He added: "I hope you have enjoyed the stories we have told about the characters we have built. I feel so blessed to be part of this community. I feel so thankful to be able to work on this game and to add something valuable to your lives." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Most-Downloaded App Store Games Of 2025 Include Fortnite, Minecraft, And Balatro
description: Apple has revealed the most-downloaded games on iPhone and iPad for this year, as well as the top Apple Arcade titles. The lists contain quite a few familiar faces--like Fortnite and Minecraft--but Balatro stands out for 2025. That's because the game not only shows up on the paid mobile charts, but it's also No. 3 for Apple Arcade--the subscription service. Fortnite is No. 2 for free iPhone games and No. 3 for free iPad games. The battle-royale title finally returned to iOS in May in the US after roughly five years, as developer Epic Games and Apple engaged in a lengthy legal battle. Meanwhile, Minecraft claimed the top spots for paid iPhone and iPad games. That makes it two years in a row, as Minecraft held both positions in the most-downloaded App Store games for 2024, too. The Best Apple Arcade Games Available In 2025 See More The top free iPhone game is Block Blast, with Roblox taking the top spot in free iPad titles. Meanwhile, sports games reign supreme on Apple Arcade: NFL Retro Bowl '26 is No. 1, followed by NBA 2K25 Arcade Edition at No. 2. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Next Fortnite Collab Will Reportedly Feature Bleach Characters
description: The Fortnite collabs look like they could be off to a strong start next year, with leaks suggesting that a Bleach crossover is coming. According to the leaks, it's set to launch in early 2026 during Chapter 7 Season 1. Since the season is set to end on March 4, the most likely release window is January or February. First spotted by noted dataminer SamLeakss, the collab could feature not just a character skin but also Ichigo's theme, "Number One." So the skin seems likely to be Ichigo himself. BLEACH COLLAB GOT LEAKED WHILE I WAS ASLEEP üíÄ- Will be released in Early 2026- Includes at least 1 skin- "Number One - Bankai" Song - First spotted by @SamLeakss pic.twitter.com/CeRDCmisKt ‚Äî Shiina (@ShiinaBR) December 10, 2025 Fortnite has been packed with collaborations lately, incorporating characters and icons from various worlds. In the past year alone, players have seen crossovers with horror legend Ghost Face, the viral Skibidi Toilet meme, Metal Gear Solid's Snake, and even recent pop-culture giants like KPop Demon Hunters and Squid Game. title: Hell Let Loose: Vietnam Gameplay Trailer Shows Just How Explosive 50v50 Jungle Warfare Can Be
description: Developer Expression Games has released the first gameplay trailer for Hell Let Loose: Vietnam, a hardcore 50v50 first-person shooter set during the Vietnam War. A follow-up to 2021's Hell Let Loose--which was inspired by the conflicts of World War 2--players will have to once again rely on tactical teamwork to survive. Hell Let Loose: Vietnam will feature six new maps on launch day, each described by Expression Games as a mix of dense jungle, twisting deltas, and deadly open areas. You won't just be fighting on the ground either, as military helicopters serve multiple roles. From troop deployment to fire support, reconnaissance, and tactical drops, they're an invaluable tool in any match. Players can also engage each other in naval combat, as heavily armed vessels such as the iconic US patrol boat and the PBR will be featured in the game. Maps are also riddled with tunnel networks constructed by the North Vietnamese army, and these offer strategic advantages for surprise attacks and troop movements. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: John Romero's Canceled Shooter Is Back On Again, Sort Of
description: Earlier this year, John Romero--the creator of Doom and Quake--announced that his next first-person shooter had been canceled. Although Romero and his company, Romero Games, didn't confirm that the project was a victim of Microsoft's layoffs and cutbacks, one of Romero Games' laid-off employees did. However, it appears the still-unnamed shooter isn't completely dead, according to Romero himself. During his appearance at Sal√≥n del Videojuego de Madrid (via Eurogamer), Romero confirmed that the project is back on, and that it's been given a fresh redesign. "We're not starting at ground zero," said Romero. "We can take pieces out of and put into a brand-new indie game. We have a lot of stuff we can put in the game. The design is completely different, but the team is very excited about the new design." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Viture Reveals High-Tech Cyberpunk 2077 Limited-Edition XR Glasses
description: Cyberpunk 2077 fans can now own a piece of tech that feels and looks like something you'd find at Kiroshi Opticals in Night City. To celebrate the game's fifth anniversary, CD Projekt Red partnered with Viture on limited-edition XR glasses themed around Cyberpunk 2077. The Viture x Cyberpunk 2077 5th Anniversary Collector's Edition XR Glasses are numbered to 10,000 and available to purchase now for $549 on Viture's online storefront and at select major retailers. See at Viture Viture Luma Cyber XR Glasses combine the form factor of the Luma Pro ($499) with the technical enhancements found in the Luma Ultra ($599). Officially licensed collectible editions of tech and gaming products usually cost more than standard models, so it's pretty cool that the Luma Cyber XR Glasses cost $50 less than the Luma Ultra. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Disney Dreamlight Valley - All Winter Warmth Star Path Duties And How To Complete Them
description: After its recent paid expansion, Wishblossom Ranch, Disney Dreamlight Valley is back with another free update for all players to enjoy. This time around, you can finally invite beloved Disney princess Cinderella to your valley and go through her questline to form a new friendship. However, as expected, there's also a fresh Star Path for you to tackle. The Winter Warmth Star Path includes plenty of winter-themed cosmetics, furniture, and more, giving you plenty of fun stuff to decorate your valley with this holiday season. If you're struggling to figure out how to complete any of the Star Path duties, we've got all of them listed below alongside how to solve them. title: GameStop's Struggles Continue
description: GameStop has released its latest earnings report, shining a light on how the video game retailer is performing in the market--and it was a mixed quarter for the company. Revenue came in at $821 million, compared to $860.3 million during the same period last year, and short of Wall Street projections. Profit, however, soared from $17.4 million last year to $77.1 million for the latest period. GameStop's stock price sank after the earnings report came out, with many saying the revenue miss was to blame for the falling price. Others, however, have said GameStop's strong profit-growth, along with having more than $8.8 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities (up from $4.6 billion last year) is a sign of health. Additionally, GameStop's Selling, General, and Administrative (SG&A) costs were $221.4 million for the quarter, down from $282 million during the same period last year. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: This Popular Game Pass Game Gets A Movie And TV Deal
description: The next video game set for a film/TV adaptation has been announced, and it is developer RubberBandGames' sandbox game Wobbly Life. The London-based developer has announced a deal with veteran Hollywood producer Adrian Askarieh and his Prime Universe Films company to develop Wobbly Life for film and TV. This does not mean that Wobbly Life will definitely become a film or a TV series, only that the company has secured the rights and may begin the development process. Prime Universe previously produced the Hitman movies starring Timothy Olyphant and Rupert Friend. Askarieh is also attached to the in-development Hitman TV show in the works now. Continue Reading at GameSpot
